meanings.definition: To soften or knead (a substance) by mixing or rubbing.
meanings.sent1: I will malax the dough to make it easier to shape into bread.
meanings.sent2: She likes to malax the clay before sculpting it into beautiful shapes.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to malax the ingredients together to create a unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: The artist's hands malax the paint on the canvas, creating a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The masseuse gently malaxes the muscles, relieving tension and promoting relaxation.

meanings.definition: To soothe or calm (someone) by gentle manipulation or handling.
meanings.sent1: The therapist will malax your shoulders to help you relax.
meanings.sent2: The mother gently malaxes her baby's back to help them fall asleep.
meanings.sent3: The soothing music and warm tea malaxed her worries away.
meanings.sent4: His kind words malaxed her anxious heart, bringing peace and comfort.
meanings.sent5: The gentle touch of a friend can malax your troubles and make everything seem better.
